member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgIsMaster
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the command line argument "-sync_master" equals to 1.
member.returns: true if the command line argument "-sync_master" equals to 1; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgUdpPort
member.summary: Returns the UDP port value set by the command line argument "-sync_port".
member.returns: UDP port number. The default value is 8890.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgAddressingMethod
member.summary: Returns the addressing mode value set by the command line argument "-sync_method".
member.returns: Current addressing mode: one of the ADDRESSING_METHOD enum values.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgSwapSyncMode const
member.summary: Returns the swap synchronization mode set by the command line argument "-sync_swap".

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgPeersCount
member.summary: Returns the number of peers set by the command line argument "-sync_count".
member.returns: Number of peers. The default value is 1. The number of peers includes all Slaves in the network + the Master.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgBroadcastAddress
member.summary: Returns the broadcast address of the Master set by the command line argument "-sync_broadcast_address".
member.returns: Broadcast address of the Master.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgMulticastAddress
member.summary: Returns the multicast address of the Master set by the command line argument "-sync_multicast_address".
member.returns: Multicast address of the Master. The default value is 239.0.0.1

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgMasterAddress
member.summary: Returns the IP address of the Master set by the command line argument "-sync_master_address".Available for Slave only.
member.returns: IP address of the Master.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgUdpSlavePort
member.summary: Returns the UDP port used by the Slave set by the command line argument "-sync_slave_port".Available for Slave only.
member.returns: UDP port used by the Slave. The default value is 0 (any unused port available).

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getArgAllowExtraSlaves
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if additional Slaves can be connected after starting the session set by the command line argument "-sync_allow_extra_slaves".Available for Slave only.
member.returns: true if additional Slaves can be connected after starting the session; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initMaster
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Master application using values specified via the command-line arguments.
member.returns: Pointer to the Master interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initMasterBroadcast(int,char,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Master application with the broadcast mode enabled. Slaves must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: Total number of Syncker hosts in the network (including the Master itself). Similar to specifying the -sync_count command-line argument.
Broadcast address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_broadcast_address command-line argument.
Broadcast address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_broadcast_address command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the Master interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initMasterMulticast(int,char,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Master application with the multicast mode enabled.
member.param: Total number of Syncker hosts in the network (including the Master itself). Similar to specifying the -sync_count command-line argument.
Multicast address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_multicast_address command-line argument.
UDP port to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the Master interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initMasterUnicast(int,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Master application with the broadcast mode enabled. Slaves must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: Total number of Syncker hosts in the network (including the Master itself). Similar to specifying the -sync_count command-line argument.
UDP port to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the Master interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.isMasterInitialized
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Master was initialized.
member.returns: true if the Master was initialized; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getMaster
member.summary: Returns the master interface.
member.returns: Pointer to the Master interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSlave
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Slave application using values specified via the command-line arguments.
member.returns: Pointer to the Slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.isSlaveInitialized
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the slave was initialized.
member.returns: 1 if the slave was initialized; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getSlave
member.summary: Returns the Slave interface.
member.returns: Pointer to the slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.isSynckerInitialized
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Syncker (Master or Slave) was initialized.
member.returns: 1 if the Syncker (master or slave) was initialized; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.getSyncker
member.summary: Returns the base class interface for Master and Slave.
member.returns: Pointer to the syncker interface. It is the base class for Master and Slave.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.setDebugWindow(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if the Syncker's debug window is open.
member.param: Enable flag. Use 1 to show the debug window, or 0 - to hide it.
member.returns: 1 if the Syncker's debug window is open; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.isDebugWindow
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Syncker's debug window is enabled.
member.returns: true if the Syncker's debug window is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.destroySyncker
member.summary: Performs shutdown and destroys the Syncker. Called automatically, when the plugin is unloaded.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSlaveBroadcast(unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Slave application with the broadcast mode enabled. Master's IP address will be detected automatically. Master must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: UDP port to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSlaveBroadcast(char,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Slave application with the specified parameters and the broadcast mode enabled. Master's IP address is specified explicitly. Master must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: Master IP address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_master_address command-line argument.
UDP port to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSlaveMulticast(char,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Slave application with the specified parameters and the multicast mode enabled. Master's IP address will be detected automatically. Master must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: Multicast address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_multicast_address command-line argument.
UDP port to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSlaveMulticast(char,char,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Slave application with the specified parameters and the multicast mode enabled. Master's IP address is specified explicitly. Master must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: Master IP address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_master_address command-line argument.
Multicast address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_multicast_address command-line argument.
UDP port to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSlaveUnicast(unsignedshort,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Slave application with the specified parameters and the unicast mode enabled. Master's IP address will be detected automatically. Master must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: UDP port to be used by the Master.
UDP port to be used by the Slave. Similar to specifying the -sync_slave_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSlaveUnicast(char,unsignedshort,unsignedshort,Syncker::SWAP_SYNC_MODE)
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as the Slave application with the specified parameters and the unicast mode enabled. Master's IP address is specified explicitly. Master must be initialized with broadcast mode enabled as well.
member.param: Master IP address to be used. Similar to specifying the -sync_master_address command-line argument.
UDP port to be used by the Master.
UDP port to be used by the Slave. Similar to specifying the -sync_slave_port command-line argument.
Swap synchronization mode to be used by the Syncker. Similar to specifying the -sync_swap command-line argument.
member.returns: Pointer to the slave interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.initSyncker
member.summary: Initializes the Syncker as Master or Slave application depending on the values specified via the command-line arguments.
member.returns: Pointer to the syncker interface. It is the base class for Master and Slave.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Manager.get
member.summary: Returns the Manager interface.
member.returns: Pointer to the manager interface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.setInterpolation(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if interpolation and extrapolation should be enabled for the computer to tackle the problem of lost packets between the master and slaves.
member.param: true to enable interpolation and extrapolation for the computer; false - to disable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.isInterpolation const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if interpolation and extrapolation are enabled for the computer to tackle the problem of lost packets between the master and slaves.
member.returns: true if interpolation and extrapolation are enabled for the computer; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.isInterpolation(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node}) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the given node is interpolated by the Syncker.
member.param: Node to be checked.
member.returns: true if the given node is interpolated by the Syncker; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.setInterpolationPeriod(double)
member.summary: Sets the interpolation period value for the computer. It is recommended to use this method when setting the frequency of sending packets to Slaves.
member.param: Interpolation period value, in seconds. The default value is 0.04.The value should not be less than 1/getSendRate(), otherwise the image shall be "stuttering".

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getInterpolationPeriod const
member.summary: Returns the current interpolation period value for the computer.
member.returns: Interpolation period value, in seconds. The default value is 0.04.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.setExtrapolationPeriod(double)
member.summary: Sets the extrapolation period value for the computer.
member.param: Extrapolation period value, in seconds. The default value is 0.04.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getExtrapolationPeriod const
member.summary: Returns the current extrapolation period value for the computer.
member.returns: Extrapolation period value, in seconds. The default value is 0.2.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.setView(int,char)
member.summary: Assigns the specified display or projector stored in the configuration file to the specified display of the computer.
member.param: Display number to assign the viewport to.
Name of the display or projector stored in the configuration file that represents the viewport.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getView(int) const
member.summary: Returns the current display or projector stored in the configuration file and assigned to the given display of the computer.
member.param: Display number.
member.returns: Name of the display or projector stored in the configuration file and assigned to the given display.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.clearViews
member.summary: Clears all views assigned to the displays of the computer.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.setDebug(bool,int,int,int)
member.summary: Enables or disables displaying of debug information at the specified position on the screen.
member.param: true to display the debug information; false - to hide it.
Horizontal margin of the debug information block. The default value is 10.
Vertical margin of the debug information block. The default value is 10.
Alignment mask. One of the Gui::ALIGN_* variables or their combination. The default value is Gui::ALIGN_RIGHT | Gui::ALIGN_BOTTOM.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.isDebug
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the debug information is to be displayed.
member.returns: true if the debug information is to be displayed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getAddressingMethod const
member.summary: Returns the packet addressing method currently used by the Syncker for communication.
member.returns: Packets addressing mode currently used by the Syncker.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.setDisconnectTimeout(float)
member.summary: Sets the timeout period after which a Slave shall be considered as disconnected.
member.param: Duration of the timeout period, in seconds.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getDisconnectTimeout const
member.summary: Returns the current timeout period after which a Slave is considered as disconnected.
member.returns: Duration of the timeout period, in seconds.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getProjections const
member.summary: Returns the interface for managing projections configuration via API (see the Projections class).
member.returns: Projections class instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getViewOffset
member.summary: Returns the current view offset. The view offset is used in CAVE systems to reflect the current viewer's head position. It can also be used for parallax adjustment insid the cockpit.
member.returns: A vec3 vector representing components of the the view offset along X, Y, and Z axes, in meters.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.sendMessage(char,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Blob},Syncker::DELIVERY_METHOD)
member.summary: Sends a user message contained in the specified buffer using the given delivery method to the specified named channel via the UDP protocol.
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels.
Buffer, containing the user message.
member.returns: true if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.setMessageReceivedCallback(char,Unigine.CallbackBase)
member.summary: Sets a callback function to be fired when a UDP user message is sent. A callback is executed in the Main Thread, but it is undefined when exactly - either in update(), or postUpdate(), or swap().
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels. If the specified channel does not exist, it shall be created.
Callback pointer.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getSwapSyncMode const
member.summary: Returns the buffer swap synchronization mode currently used by the Syncker.
member.returns: Current swap synchronization mode used by the Syncker. One of the following:DEFAULT - default syncronization mode.NVIDIA - NVIDIA buffer swap synchronization. Detailed information on current sync status is displayed in the console (available only for NVIDIA Quadro GPUs with G-SYNC support).

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getTime const
member.summary: Returns the current Master frame time (even if called from a Slave computer), it is the time of the last buffer swap operation (i.e., beginning of the next frame). This method is more accurate than the same method of the Game class and returns a double-precision value.
member.returns: Current Master frame time, in seconds.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.getIFps const
member.summary: Returns the duration of the last frame. This method is more accurate than the same method of the Game class and returns a double-precision value.
member.returns: Duration of the previous frame, in seconds.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.RELIABLE
member.summary: Reliable delivery mode. Reliable and sequenced mode, enabled by default. All packets shall be delivered to the recipient in the exact order they were sent.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.SEQUENCED
member.summary: Sequenced delivery mode. Packets may be lost, but never duplicated, they arrive in the exact order they were sent.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.UNRELIABLE
member.summary: Unreliable delivery mode. Pure UDP. Packets may be lost, duplicated, or received in an order that differs from the one they were sent. Packets are not compressed, fragmented, or merged.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.MULTICAST
member.summary: Multicast addressing mode (one-to-many): hosts have different IP-addresses, but a single port.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.UNICAST
member.summary: Unicast addressing mode (one-to-one): hosts have different IP-addresses (some may be the same) and different ports.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.BROADCAST
member.summary: Broadcast addressing mode (one-to-all): hosts have different IP-addresses, but a single port.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.NVIDIA
member.summary: NVIDIA buffer swap synchronization. Detailed information on current sync status is displayed in the console. This mode is available only for NVIDIA Quadro GPUs with G-SYNC support.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Syncker.DEFAULT
member.summary: Default buffer swap synchronization.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getNumSlaves
member.summary: Returns the total number of the slaves connected to the Master.
member.returns: Total number of slaves connected to the Master.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSlaveAddress(int)
member.summary: Returns the network address of the given slave computer.
member.param: Slave number.
member.returns: Network address of the slave computer.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSlavePort(int)
member.summary: Returns the UDP port used by the slave with the specified number.
member.param: Slave number.
member.returns: UDP port of the specified slave computer. 0 - means any unused port available.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSlaveID(int)
member.summary: Returns the ID of the slave with the specified number. A unique Slave ID consists of two parts: IP (32 bits) + port (16 bits)
member.param: Slave number.
member.returns: ID of the slave with the specified number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSlaveWorldName(int)
member.summary: Returns the name of the world file currently loaded on the specified slave.
member.param: Slave number.
member.returns: Name of the world file currently loaded on the specified slave.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSlaveView(int,int)
member.summary: Returns the name of the display or projector stored in the configuration file and assigned to the given display of the given slave computer.
member.param: Slave number.
Display number.
member.returns: Name of the display or projector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSyncPlayer(bool)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of the current player's parameters via the UDP protocol: Its transformation Projection matrix Viewport mask Mask for reflections Applied post-materials (if any) Current player synchronization is used only when all slaves use the same camera.
member.param: true to enable synchronization; false - to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isSyncPlayer
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if synchronization of the current player is enabled. Current player synchronization is used only when all slaves use the same camera.
member.returns: true if synchronization of the current player is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSyncRender(bool)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of all render parameters via the UDP protocol: light scattering, occlusion, etc. When all slaves use the same rendering settings, synchronization of render parameters can be disabled.
member.param: true to enable synchronization; false - to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isSyncRender
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if synchronization of all render parameters is enabled. When all slaves use the same rendering settings, synchronization of render parameters can be disabled.
member.returns: true if synchronization of all render parameters is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.addSyncNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},unsignedchar)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of parameters of the given node via the UDP protocol. Scene nodes are not synchronized by default, this method is used to add a particular node to the synchronization queue.
member.param: Node to synchronize.
Synchronization mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.addSyncNodes(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},unsignedchar)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of parameters of given nodes via the UDP protocol. Scene nodes are not synchronized by default, this method is used to add particular nodes to the synchronization queue.
member.param: List of nodes to synchronize.
Synchronization mask.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSyncNodeMask(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},unsignedchar)
member.summary: Sets a new synchronization mask for the specified node. Synchronization mask can be used for optimization reasons limiting the amount of data to be synchronized and thus reducing network load. For example, for moving parts of a helicopter we can set a mask to synchronize only node transformations:
member.param: Node for which a new synchronization mask is to be set.
New synchronization mask to be set for the specified node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSyncNodeMask(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Returns the synchronization mask for the specified node.
member.param: Node, for which a synchronization mask is to be obtained.
member.returns: Synchronization mask of the specified node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isSyncNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if synchronization of the given node is enabled. Using this method you can quickly check if a node is monitored by the Syncker (node's states are dispatched to Slaves over the network).
member.param: Node to be checked.
member.returns: true if synchronization of the given node is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getNumSyncNodes
member.summary: Returns the total number of nodes in the synchronization queue.
member.returns: Total number of nodes in the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSyncNode(int)
member.summary: Returns the synchronized node with the given number.
member.param: Node number in the synchronization queue.
member.returns: Synchronized node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeSyncNode(int)
member.summary: Removes the specified node from the synchronization queue.
member.param: Node number in the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeSyncNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Removes the specified node from the synchronization queue.
member.param: Node to be removed from synchronization.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeSyncNodeID(int)
member.summary: Removes the specified node from the synchronization queue by its ID.
member.param: ID of the node to be removed from the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeSyncNodes(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Removes the specified nodes from the synchronization queue.
member.param: List of nodes to be removed from the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.clearSyncNodes
member.summary: Removes all nodes from the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.addSyncMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
member.summary: Enables synchronization of the given material via the UDP protocol. Scene materials are not synchronized by default, this method is used to add a particular material to the synchronization queue.
member.param: Material to synchronize.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.addSyncMaterials(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Enables synchronization of given materials via the UDP protocol. Scene materials are not synchronized by default, this method is used to add particular materials to the synchronization queue.
member.param: List of materials to synchronize.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isSyncMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if synchronization of the given material is enabled. Using this method you can quickly check if a material is monitored by the Syncker (material's states are dispatched to Slaves over the network).
member.param: Material to be checked.
member.returns: true if synchronization of the given material is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getNumSyncMaterials
member.summary: Returns the total number of materials in the synchronization queue.
member.returns: Total number of materials in the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSyncMaterial(int)
member.summary: Returns the synchronized material with the given number.
member.param: Material number in the synchronization queue.
member.returns: Synchronized material.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeSyncMaterial(int)
member.summary: Removes the material with the given number from the synchronization queue.
member.param: Material number in the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeSyncMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
member.summary: Removes the specified material from the synchronization queue.
member.param: Material to be removed from the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeSyncMaterials(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Removes the specified materials from the synchronization queue.
member.param: List of materials to be removed from the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.clearSyncMaterials
member.summary: Removes all materials from the synchronization queue.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.createNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},unsignedchar)
member.summary: Synchronizes creation of the given node on all Slaves. This method is to be called after node creation on the Master. It is recommended to use the loadNode() or loadNodereference() methods whenever possible as this approach allows adding nodes of all types, unlike the createNode() method that supports only a limited number of them. Example:
member.param: Node to create.
Synchronization mask.
member.returns: true if the node was created successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.deleteNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Synchronizes deletion of the given node (with all its children) on the Master and all Slaves. Similar to calling deleteLater() for the node.
member.param: Node to delete.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isNodeCreatedBySyncker(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the given node was created via the createNode() method. Using this method you can quickly check if a node is in the run-time objects creation buffer.
member.param: Node to be checked.
member.returns: true if the given node was created via the createNode() method; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSlavePlayer(int,Unigine.Ptr{Player})
member.summary: Sets the specified player for the specified Slave. Synchronization of the main master camera is disabled.
member.param: Slave number in the range from to the total number of slaves.
Player to be set.
member.returns: true if the specified player was successfully set for the specified Slave; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSlavePlayer(char,Unigine.Ptr{Player})
member.summary: Sets the specified player for all Slave computers using the specified view (see the sync_view argument). Synchronization of the main master camera is disabled.
member.param: Name of the view (display or projector).
Player to be set.
member.returns: true if the specified player was successfully set for all Slave computers using the specified view; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSendRate(float)
member.summary: Sets the frequency of sending packets to Slaves. Use this method when network load is too high and slows down the whole IG system. It is recommended to use this method with interpolation enabled.
member.param: Frequency of sending packets to Slaves. The default value is -1 (every frame).The value should not be less than 1/getInterpolationPeriod(), otherwise the image shall be "stuttering".

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getSendRate
member.summary: Returns the current frequency of sending packets to Slaves. Use this method when network load is too high and slows down the whole IG system. It is recommended to use this method with interpolation enabled.
member.returns: Frequency of sending packets to Slaves.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setAllowExtraSlaves(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if new Slaves can connect to the Master after starting the session. This can be used, for example, to connect a Slave which is used as a tool for configuring projections and does not operate as an IG.
member.param: true to permit new Slaves connecting to the Master after starting the session; false - to forbid it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isAllowExtraSlaves
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if new Slaves can connect to the Master after starting the session. This can be used, for example, to connect a Slave which is used as a tool for configuring projections and does not operate as an IG.
member.returns: true if new Slaves can connect to the Master after starting the session; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setViewOffset(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Sets a new player's head position on the Master.
member.param: New player's head position coordinates to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSyncViewOffset(bool)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of view offset for projections via the UDP protocol.
member.param: true to enable synchronization; false - to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isSyncViewOffset
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if synchronization of view offset for projections is enabled.
member.returns: true if synchronization of view offset for projections is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setSyncWorldLoad(bool)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of world loading via the UDP protocol.
member.param: true to enable synchronization; false - to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isSyncWorldLoad
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if synchronization of world loading is enabled.
member.returns: true if synchronization of world loading is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.setDefaultSyncNodes(unsignedchar)
member.summary: Sets a new mask defining types of nodes that will be synchronized automatically after world loading. This mask can be used for optimization reasons limiting the number of nodes to be synchronized and thus reducing network load. For example, you can restrict automatic synchronization to global water, and clouds only:
member.param: Mask defining types of nodes that will be synchronized automatically after world loading.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getDefaultSyncNodes
member.summary: Returns the current mask defining types of nodes that will be synchronized automatically after world loading. This mask can be used for optimization reasons limiting the number of nodes to be synchronized and thus reducing network load.
member.returns: Current mask defining types of nodes that will be synchronized automatically after world loading.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.loadWorld(char)
member.summary: Loads a world from the specified file on the Master and all Slaves. Syncker is able to automatically synchronize the current world, but it works as follows: Slaves shall only start loading a new world after it is completely loaded on the Master. This method provides a 2x speedup of world loading process, as it forces all hosts to start loading the world almost simultaneously.
member.param: Path to the *.world file to be loaded.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.loadNode(char,unsignedchar,Unigine.Math.Mat4)
member.summary: Loads a node from the specified file to the world on the Master and all Slaves and places it to the specified ititial transformation. This is a network analogue of the loadNode() method of the World class. By default, the loaded node is not synchronized, which is suitable for static objects at run time and at the same time saves performance. For dynamic objects to be synchronized, the suitable synchronization mask should be set.
member.param: Path to the *.node file.
Synchronization mask, one of the SYNC_MASK values.
Initial transformation of the node.
member.returns: Loaded node or nullptr if an error has occurred.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.loadNode(char,unsignedchar)
member.summary: Loads a node from the specified file to the world on the Master and all Slaves and places it at the origin with the default transformation. This is a network analogue of the loadNode() method of the World class. By default, the loaded node is not synchronized, which is suitable for static objects at run time and at the same time saves performance. For dynamic objects to be synchronized, the suitable synchronization mask should be set.
member.param: Path to the *.node file.
Synchronization mask, one of the SYNC_MASK values.
member.returns: Loaded node or nullptr if an error has occurred.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.loadNodeReference(char,unsignedchar,Unigine.Math.Mat4)
member.summary: Loads a node reference from the specified file to the world on the Master and all Slaves and places it to the specified ititial transformation. This is a network analogue of the NodeReference class constructor. By default, the loaded node is not synchronized, which is suitable for static objects at run time and at the same time saves performance. For dynamic objects to be synchronized, the suitable synchronization mask should be set.
member.param: Path to the *.node file.
Synchronization mask, one of the SYNC_MASK values.
Initial transformation of the node.
member.returns: Node Reference instance if it was loaded successfully; otherwise nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.loadNodeReference(char,unsignedchar)
member.summary: Loads a node reference from the specified file to the world on the Master and all Slaves and places it to the origin with default transformation. This is a network analogue of the NodeReference class constructor. By default, the loaded node is not synchronized, which is suitable for static objects at run time and at the same time saves performance. For dynamic objects to be synchronized, the suitable synchronization mask should be set.
member.param: Path to the *.node file.
Synchronization mask, one of the SYNC_MASK values.
member.returns: Node Reference instance if it was loaded successfully; otherwise nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.isNodeLoadedBySyncker(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the given node was loaded by the Syncker via the loadNode() or the loadNodeReference() method.
member.param: Node to be checked.
member.returns: true if the given node was created via the createNode() method; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.addCallback(Unigine.Master.CALLBACK_INDEX,Unigine.CallbackBase)
member.summary: Adds a callback of the specified type. Callback functions can be used to determine actions to be performed when sending or receiving user messages, as well as when changing settings on the Master or a Slave. The signature of the callback function can be one of the following:
member.param: Callback type. One of the following values:SESSION_STARTEDSESSION_CONTINUEDSESSION_FINISHEDSLAVE_CONNECTEDSLAVE_DISCONNECTEDMASTER_SETUP_CHANGEDSLAVE_SETUP_CHANGED
Callback pointer.
member.returns: Number of the last added callback of the specified type, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeCallback(Unigine.Master.CALLBACK_INDEX,void)
member.summary: Removes a given callback from the list of callbacks of the specified type. Callback functions can be used to determine actions to be performed when sending or receiving user messages, as well as when changing settings on the Master or a Slave.
member.param: Callback type. One of the following values:SESSION_STARTEDSESSION_CONTINUEDSESSION_FINISHEDSLAVE_CONNECTEDSLAVE_DISCONNECTEDMASTER_SETUP_CHANGEDSLAVE_SETUP_CHANGED
Callback pointer.
member.returns: true if the position callback with the given ID was removed successfully; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.clearCallbacks(Unigine.Master.CALLBACK_INDEX)
member.summary: Clears all added callbacks of the specified type. Callback functions can be used to determine actions to be performed when sending or receiving user messages, as well as when changing settings on the Master or a Slave.
member.param: Callback type. One of the following values:SESSION_STARTEDSESSION_CONTINUEDSESSION_FINISHEDSLAVE_CONNECTEDSLAVE_DISCONNECTEDMASTER_SETUP_CHANGEDSLAVE_SETUP_CHANGED

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.addMessageToBuffer(char,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Blob})
member.summary: Adds a message to the buffer to be received by additional slaves as soon as they connect.
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels.
Buffer containing the user message.
member.returns: Message ID.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getNumBufferedMessages(char) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of buffered messages.
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels.
member.returns: Total number of buffered messages.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getBufferedMessageID(char,int) const
member.summary: Returns the ID of the buffered message by its index.
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels.
Message index number.
member.returns: Message ID.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.getBufferedMessage(char,int) const
member.summary: Returns the buffer containing the message.
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels.
Message ID.
member.returns: Buffer containing the user message.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.removeBufferedMessage(char,int)
member.summary: Removes the specified message from the buffer.
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels.
Message ID.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.clearBufferedMessages(char)
member.summary: Removes all messages from the buffer.
member.param: Channel name. Multiple systems may use Syncker's network simultaneously (e.g. IG and user's application). For convenience, all messages are sent and received via named channels.

member.summary: Callback to be fired on changing settings on the Master. Callback signature:

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.SLAVE_SETUP_CHANGED

member.summary: Callback function to be fired on continuing a session. Callback signature:

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.SESSION_STARTED
member.summary: Callback function to be fired on starting a session (all Slaves are connected, MTU is determined). Callback signature:

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.OBJECT_SURFACE
member.summary: Update all paramters of surfaces (surface flags and information about inherited materials for each surface).

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.OBJECT
member.summary: Update object parameters. All other parameters of objects except for NODE_FLAGS and TRANSFORM (particles trasform for object particles, bones transform for object skinned)

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.DERIVED
member.summary: Update information of derived class (11111000 - without the first 3 bits).

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.TRANSFORM
member.summary: Update node transform (with interpolation).

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.NODE_FLAGS
member.summary: Update only simple node flag (enabled, etc.)

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.OBJECT_PARTICLES
member.summary: Particle system. See the ObjectParticles class.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.CLOUD_LAYER
member.summary: Cloud layer. See the ObjectCloudLayer class.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.WATER_GLOBAL
member.summary: Global water. See the ObjectWaterGlobal class.

member.name: F:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Master.LIGHT_WORLD
member.summary: World light. See the LightWorld class.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.getMasterNodeID(int)
member.summary: Returns the ID of a dynamic node on the Master by its local ID on the Slave. A Slave does not create an exact copy of a node created on the Master, their IDs do not match. So, knowing an ID of a local copy of a node created on the Master, you can easily find its original on the Master. This can be used in user messages, when you need to apply some specific modifications to source node on the Master.
member.param: Node's ID on the Slave.
member.returns: ID of the node on the Master.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.getSlaveNodeID(int)
member.summary: Returns the local ID of a dynamic node on the Slave by its ID on the Master. A Slave does not create an exact copy of a node created on the Master, their IDs do not match. So, if you created a node on the Master and then called the Syncker::Master::createNode() method, you can easily find its copy on the current Slave. This can be used in user messages, when you need to apply some specific modifications to a Slave's copy of a node, that was created on the Master.
member.param: Node's ID on the Master.
member.returns: ID of the node on the Slave.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.addSyncNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of parameters of the given node via the UDP protocol. Scene nodes are not synchronized by default, this method is used to add a particular node to the synchronization queue.
member.param: Node to synchronize.
ID of the node on the Master.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.addSyncNodeID(int,int)
member.summary: Enables synchronization of parameters of the given node via the UDP protocol. Scene nodes are not synchronized by default, this method is used to add a particular node (by its id) to the synchronization queue.
member.param: ID of the node on the Slave.
ID of the node on the Master.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.removeSyncNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Removes the specified node from the synchronization queue.
member.param: Node to be removed.
member.returns: true if the node was successfully removed from the synchronization queue; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.removeSyncNodeID(int)
member.summary: Removes the node with the given number from the synchronization queue.
member.param: Node number in the synchronization queue.
member.returns: true if the node was successfully removed from the synchronization queue; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.getID
member.summary: Returns the current ID of the Slave.
member.returns: ID of the slave combined as follows: IP address (32 bits) + port number (16 bits).

member.summary: Sets the skip flags enabling you to ignore certain information from the Master.

slave->setSkipFlags(GAME | WORLD_LOAD | USER_DATA);

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Slave.getSkipFlags
member.summary: Returns the current skip flags combination enabling you to ignore certain information from the Master.
member.returns: A combination of currently used skip flags.

Callback pointer.
member.returns: Number of the last added callback of the specified type, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, -1.

Callback pointer.
member.returns: true if the position callback with the given ID was removed successfully; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Projections.setEnabled(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if projections on this host are to be modified by the Synker. You can disable this option, when using Syncker only for synchronization of node transformations (and/or transfer data) and modification of projections is unnecessary.
member.param: true to enable modification of projections on this host by the Syncker; false - to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Projections.isEnabled
member.summary: Returns the current value indicating if projections on this host are to be modified by the Synker. You can disable this option, when using Syncker only for synchronization of node transformations (and/or transfer data) and modification of projections is unnecessary.
member.returns: true if modification of projections on this host by the Syncker is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets a value indicating if Synckers Projection Configurator window is shown.
member.param: true to show Synckers Projection Configurator window; false - to hide it.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Projections.isConfiguratorEnabled
member.summary: Returns the current value indicating if Synckers Projection Configurator window is shown.
member.returns: true if modification of projections on this host by the Syncker is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Projections.saveProjections(char,bool)
member.summary: Saves the current projections configuration to the specified file. You can use this method to migrate old binary files to the new XML format.
member.param: Name of the file to which the current projections configuration shall be saved.
Binary flag. Set true to save configuration in binary format; false - to save in XML format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Projections.loadProjections(char,bool)
member.summary: Loads projections configuration from the specified file. You can use this method to migrate old binary files to the new XML format.
member.param: Name of the file with projections configuration to be loaded.
Binary flag. Set true to load configuration from a binary file; false - to load configuration from an XML file.

member.returns: true if the specified projector is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Projections.setProjectorName(int,char)
member.summary: Sets a new name for the projector with the specified number.
member.param: Number of the projector in the range from 0 to the total number of projectors.
New name to be set for the specified projector.

member.summary: Returns the name of the projector with the specified number.
member.param: Number of the projector in the range from 0 to the total number of projectors.

member.name: M:Unigine.Plugins.Syncker.Projections.setProjectorTransform(int,Unigine.Math.Mat4)
member.summary: Sets a new transformation for the projector with the specified number.
member.param: Number of the projector in the range from 0 to the total number of projectors.
New transformation to be set for the specified projector. The transformation includes position (relative to the viewer), rotation, and size (width and height).

member.summary: Returns the current transformation of the projector with the specified number.
member.param: Number of the projector in the range from 0 to the total number of projectors.
member.returns: Current transformation of the specified projector.
